abstract.text: Initiate install validation by displaying a view-through ad with signed parameters.

metadata.title: Generating the signature to validate view-through ads

inlineContent.text: Install validation informs an ad network when users install and launch an app they purchase after viewing an ad. Ad networks provide an ad with cryptographically signed information that includes their ad network ID. If the ad results in a conversion, the customer’s device sends install-validation postbacks. For information about attribution-winning and nonwinning postbacks, see
Starting in iOS 14.5 with SKAdNetwork 2.2, ad networks can present view-through ads to provide custom ads using any media.
These instructions are for signing view-through ads. If you’re presenting a StoreKit-rendered ad, see
To provide a view-through ad and initiate a validation, the app calls
, presents the ad, and then calls
. The ad network needs to generate the
in the
instance that both methods share.
Ad networks generate the signature on their server using their ad network ID and the PKCS#8 private key they establish when registering to use the API. For more information, see
Create an instance of
to set the properties for the ad impression. These properties contain the same values you use to generate the signature.
The following table maps the parameters you use in the signature string to their equivalent
properties, as the code example demonstrates in the
section below:
Signature parameter
Equivalent properties
.  For view-through ads, use version 2.2 and later.
for version 3 or earlier. For version 4 and later, the
replaces this parameter.
for version 4 and later. This parameter replaces the

An additional parameter in the signature that isn’t part of

The order and content of the signature parameters depends on the
of the signature you’re creating. Choose one of the parameter combinations below, based on your
To generate a signature for version 4 or later, combine the signature parameter values into a UTF-8 string with an invisible separator (
) between them, in the exact order the code below shows:

code: version + '\u2063' + ad-network-id + '\u2063' + source-identifier + '\u2063' + itunes-item-id + '\u2063' + nonce + '\u2063' + source-app-id + '\u2063' + fidelity-type + '\u2063' + timestamp

inlineContent.text: To generate a signature for versions 2.2 and 3, combine the signature parameter values into a UTF-8 string with an invisible separator (
) between them, in the exact order the code below shows:

code: version + '\u2063' + ad-network-id + '\u2063' + campaign-id + '\u2063' + itunes-item-id + '\u2063' + nonce + '\u2063' + source-app-id + '\u2063' + fidelity-type + '\u2063' + timestamp

inlineContent.text: Use the most recent version available in the SDK whenever possible. For information about availability, see
Sign the combined UTF-8 string with the following key and algorithm:
Your PKCS#8 private key.
The Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) with a SHA-256 hash.
The resulting Digital Encoding Rules (DER)-formatted binary value is the signature.
Encode the binary signature you generate into a Base64 string. The result is your ad network attribution signature,
, to use for view-through ads. The signature string should resemble the following:
For more information about Base64 encoding, see
After you generate the signature, you have all the required values for your
instance and can use it to call
. Present your view-through ad, and then call
using the same
instance.

abstract.text: Returns a Base-64 encoded string.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
A class that defines an ad impression for a view-through ad.
A number that represents the advertising network’s campaign.
A random value to use for added security.
A string that represents the advertising network’s unique identifier.
The App Store ID of the app that the ad impression advertises.
The advertising network’s cryptographic signature for the ad impression.
The App Store ID of the app that displays the ad.
A four-digit integer that ad networks define to represent the ad campaign.
A number that represents the UNIX time, in milliseconds, of the ad impression.
The version of the SKAdNetwork API.
A class that validates advertisement-driven app installations.
Indicates that your app is no longer presenting a view-through ad to the user.
Indicates that your app is presenting a view-through ad to the user.
Validate advertisement-driven app installations.
Initiate install validation by displaying a StoreKit-rendered ad with signed parameters.

abstract.text: Learn about timeframes and priorities for ad impressions that result in ad attributions, and how additional impressions qualify for postbacks.
Use the install-validation APIs for your ad campaigns after registering your ad network with Apple.
Learn about the features in each SKAdNetwork version.
